content.description: Start in some foliage under a tree and break through the small canopy and onto the rock face about ten feet up.  From here go up the pedestal and then the crack/dihedral above which includes the crux.

A fun but contrived little route to try if you happened to be climbing on the adjacent cracks.  Ascend the face between Cussin' Crack and Noseprick while staying away from the cracks.  Fun and balancy face climbing on crimpers the whole way.
content.protection:
Standard TR set up.  Plenty of options for placements (large cams 3" to 4" work well.) 

  This is a TR route.  No pro on lead unless you plug stuff into the cracks off to the side.
content.location: In between Cussin' Crack and Noseprick.

content.description: Noseprick is the second crack counting from the climber's right.  Polished footholds make up the crux a little over half way up the crack.
content.protection: Standard TR set up, long slings helpful.

content.description: The Klinger is the line which goes up the face between Noseprick and Incapacitation until reaching the small crack halfway up. It is the fourth crack from the left.
Fun, easy climbing on a short face. The crack is a bit vegetated in places. This is the right-most crack on the many cracks buttress.
content.protection: TR or a couple hand sized pieces for leading.

content.description: Very similar in style and appearance to Stinger. This is a stout top-rope problem up the steepest part of the bulge on the many cracks buttress. The route starts on the easy ledges in the access gully, then at 10 feet the route starts on painfully small edges then moves into powerful side-pulling then a crux high-step and deadpoint to the one good jug. Several more 5.10+ moves on dirty rock will take you to the top.
Climb blocky stuff with ease for five to ten feet then follow the crack and find the crux about 3/4 of the way up.  My vote is 5.8, but I've entered the guidebook rating of 5.8+.
content.protection: Standard TR set up.  There are solid cracks for your anchor on this one (big 3"-4" cams helpful.)
content.location: The fourth crack counting from the climber's right (not counting The Klinger.)

content.description: A short Top-rope problem on the bulging face 5-10 feet right of Incapacitation. Long powerful reaches to huge jugs on a steep face.
This area lies between Yellow Lichen Buttress and Saturday Buttress and contains several dirty routes in the 5.8-5.9, all of which according to Mike Farris are "not worth doing".
